title: Carlos Kenig - Wikipedia
snippet: Carlos Eduardo Kenig (born November 25, 1953) is an Argentine-American mathematician and Louis Block Distinguished Service Professor in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Chicago. He is known for his work in harmonic analysis and partial differential equations.

title: Carlos E. Kenig – NAS
snippet: He obtained his PhD at the University of Chicago in 1978. After being an instructor at Princeton University and a professor at the University of Minnesota, Kenig returned to the University of Chicago in 1985.

title: Carlos E. Kenig | American Academy of Arts and Sciences
snippet: Carlos Kenig is the Louis Block Distinguished Service Professor of Mathematics at the University of Chicago. He is the co-recipient of the 2008 Maxime Bôcher Memorial Prize of the American Mathematical Society (with Charles Fefferman and Alberto ...

title: 2022-2023 Baylor Lecture Series in Mathematics | Mathematics | Baylor University
snippet: After graduation, he went to Princeton University as an Instructor and in 1980 he joined the University of Minnesota as an Assistant Professor. By 1983 he was promoted to Full Professor, and in 1985 he returned to the University of Chicago. Professor Kenig has supervised close to 40 Ph.D.

title: Carlos Kenig - The Mathematics Genealogy Project
snippet: According to our current on-line database, Carlos Kenig has 25 students and 59 descendants.
